question: [File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: log_remaining_data_after_pull()] [Metric calculation accuracy] At lines 342-392, complex filtering calculates remaining data - can incorrect filtering cause misleading operational metrics? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Author validation missing] At line 191, proof.author() is used without validation - is there cryptographic verification that the proof actually comes from claimed author? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Constructor: new()] [Peer ID spoofing] At line 81, my_peer_id is set but never validated - can incorrect peer ID cause wrong local/remote classification? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_proofs()] [Inconsistent return tuple] Returns (proofs, all_txns, unique_txns, !is_full) - the negation of is_full in return at line 454 - is this confusing and can it cause misinterpretation? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Empty return on non-full] At line 713, if not full and not return_non_full, empty Vec is returned - can this cause upstream to think there are no batches when there actually are some? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Sampling rate manipulation] At lines 253-256, gc_expired_batch_summaries_without_proofs() is sampled - can this sampling be exploited to avoid garbage collection? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_batches()] [GC timing attack] At lines 316-319, garbage collection is sampled every 500ms - can an attacker time batch insertions to avoid garbage collection cycles? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Out of order proof detection] At lines 200-210, out-of-order proofs are detected but only a counter is incremented - should out-of-order proofs be rejected instead? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_batches()] [Batch ordering] Batches can arrive before proofs (lines 301-313) - can this be exploited to cause state inconsistency if proof never arrives? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Fairness bypass through gas buckets] Can Byzantine validators collude by coordinating gas_bucket_start values to dominate block composition despite fairness shuffling at line 628? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Proof flooding] Can Byzantine validators flood the queue with valid proofs that will expire soon, causing excessive memory usage and garbage collection overhead? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: mark_committed()] [Fake commitment] If mark_committed() is called with BatchInfoExt not in the queue, is there verification that this batch was actually committed in consensus? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Struct: BatchProofQueue] [TxnSummaryWithExpiration structure] At line 65, what fields comprise TxnSummaryWithExpiration - can hash collisions cause different transactions to be treated as duplicates? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Txn summary late arrival] At lines 217-228, summaries that arrive after proof increment occurrence counter - what if summaries never arrive, leaving inconsistent counts? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Transaction expiration within batch] At lines 642-648, individual transactions in batch can expire - can partially expired batches cause execution issues? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Max txns enforcement] Multiple limits exist (max_txns, max_txns_after_filtering, soft_max) - can confusion between these limits cause blocks that violate actual constraints? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Soft limit interpretation] At line 679, soft_max_txns_after_filtering allows exceeding - can this be exploited to create consistently oversized blocks? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Excluded batches bypass] At lines 581-592, excluded_batches transactions are added to filtered_txns - can an attacker manipulate excluded_batches to censor specific transactions? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Excluded transaction leak] At line 636, excluded_batches are counted but not included - can the excluded_txns counter be used to infer private information about excluded content? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: pull_internal()] [Block timestamp precision] At line 645, block_timestamp.as_secs() loses subsecond precision - can this cause transactions with expiration in microseconds to be handled incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: handle_updated_block_timestamp()] [Duration arithmetic] At lines 724-726, checked_sub is used for time_lag - what happens if subtraction fails due to clock skew? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: gc_expired_batch_summaries_without_proofs()] [Timestamp comparison] At line 328, comparing item.info.expiration() > timestamp - should this be >= to match insert_proof logic? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_proof()] [Entry API safety] At lines 230-244, Entry API is used - can the Entry be invalidated between operations causing undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Function: insert_batches()] [Vacant entry insertion] At lines 305-312, VacantEntry is filled - what happens if the key was inserted by another thread between entry() and insert()? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/batch_proof_queue.rs] [Struct: BatchProofQueue] [BTreeMap key ordering] At line 60, BTreeMap<BatchSortKey, BatchInfoExt> relies on BatchSortKey ordering - can incorrect Ord implementation cause batches to be processed out of order? (High)
